name: Besan Laddoo (Sweet Chickpea Flour Balls With Cashews And Raisins) Indian Sweet, Vegan
description: Besan Laddoo (Sweet Chickpea Flour Balls with Cashew and Raisins) Indian Sweet. Gluten Free, Soy Free and Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon semolina flour ((fine sooji, omit this for gluten free version))
2 teaspoons quinoa flour ((optional, can be substituted with semolina flour))
2 tablespoons vegan butter ((earth balance, soy free))
3 tablespoons raw sugar ((more for sweeter balls, I like mine mildy sweet))
2 tablespoons of chopped cashews ((small pieces. large pieces will make it difficult to form balls))

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the vegan butter in a large pan on low heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt the vegan butter in a large pan on low heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the cashews and raisins in it for 2 minutes until golden and remove them leaving as much butter as possible in the pan. Alternatively, cook the cashews and raisins in about a teaspoon of butter separately.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the cashews and raisins in it for 2 minutes until golden and remove them leaving as much butter as possible in the pan. Alternatively, cook the cashews and raisins in about a teaspoon of butter separately.

recipeInstructions.text: Add coconut oil and heat with butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add coconut oil and heat with butter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the besan (chickpea flour), semolina flour, quinoa flour and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the besan (chickpea flour), semolina flour, quinoa flour and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook on medium heat and begin to roast the mixture, until it becomes light golden brown in color and gives out a sweet aroma. Stir the mixture continuously with a spatula to prevent burning. 7-10 minutes. The mixture should also start to form clumps.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook on medium heat and begin to roast the mixture, until it becomes light golden brown in color and gives out a sweet aroma. Stir the mixture continuously with a spatula to prevent burning. 7-10 minutes. The mixture should also start to form clumps.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the flour well, else it will taste raw, which is not fun.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the flour well, else it will taste raw, which is not fun.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pan from the heat and let it cool to a warm-hot temperature. (a minute)
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the pan from the heat and let it cool to a warm-hot temperature. (a minute)

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, Blend/grind the raw sugar into powder. or use powdered jaggery.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, Blend/grind the raw sugar into powder. or use powdered jaggery.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in cardamom seeds, and sugar to the flour mixture and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in cardamom seeds, and sugar to the flour mixture and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the cashews and raisins and mix well with spoon or hand to make mixture more clumpy. (1 minute)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the cashews and raisins and mix well with spoon or hand to make mixture more clumpy. (1 minute)

recipeInstructions.text: To make the balls, take about 1.5-2 Tablespoons of warm flour mixture into your palm. Gently press the mixture between your palms to form a smooth, round ball. Of course if you are in a hurry, you can just eat the flour mix like a halwa :)(dense sweet dough dessert).
recipeInstructions.name: To make the balls, take about 1.5-2 Tablespoons of warm flour mixture into your palm. Gently press the mixture between your palms to form a smooth, round ball. Of course if you are in a hurry, you can just eat the flour mix like a halwa :)(dense sweet dough dessert).

recipeInstructions.text: If the mixture doesn't form balls easily, which might happen because I use butter as less as possible, add half a tablespoon of agave syrup and a few drops of warm water and mix. Keep adding drops of water and a few drops of agave till it becomes a big clump.
recipeInstructions.name: If the mixture doesn't form balls easily, which might happen because I use butter as less as possible, add half a tablespoon of agave syrup and a few drops of warm water and mix. Keep adding drops of water and a few drops of agave till it becomes a big clump.

recipeInstructions.text: All this should be done, while the mixture is still warm-hot to touch. (you can reheat the mixture in the pan to warm-hot if it has completely cooled down). Form balls and let cool completely before storing in airtight container for 1-2 weeks. Hope you all like these Indian Sweet Balls! Have an awesome day everyone!
